verbs.description: motivate (third-person singular simple present motivates, present participle motivating, simple past and past participle motivated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To provide someone with an incentive to do something; to encourage.
examples: The weekly staff meeting was meant to motivate employees.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To animate; to propel; to cause to take action
examples: He was motivated purely by self-interest.
Steam-motivated pumps are used in manufacturing.
